com.smartnsoft.droid4me.analytics

Interface AnalyticsLogger

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AnalyticsLogger.AnalyticsDictionaryLogger<DictionaryType>, AnalyticsLogger.AnalyticsTagLogger

    public interface AnalyticsLogger
    Enables to mark that an entity needs to log some analytics when being used. This interface is usually applied to an Activity or a Fragment entity.

    Using this marker interface with the ActivityController.Interceptor makes the reporting of analytics very straightforward, and enables to centralize it in one place.

    Since:
    2012.06.02
    Author:
    Ã‰douard Mercier
    See Also:
    AnalyticsSender

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  AnalyticsLogger.AnalyticsDictionaryLogger<DictionaryType>
      An analytics logger which states the tag and a dictionary of the analytics event to report.
      static interface  AnalyticsLogger.AnalyticsDisabledLoggerAnnotation
      An annotation which enables to express that an entity, usually an Activity or a Fragment, does not wish to report any analytics usage.
      static interface  AnalyticsLogger.AnalyticsEnabledLoggerAnnotation
      An annotation which enables to express that an entity, usually an Activity or a Fragment, wishes to report analytics usage.
      static interface  AnalyticsLogger.AnalyticsTagLogger
      An analytics logger which states the tag of the analytics event to report.
      static interface  AnalyticsLogger.AnalyticsTagLoggerAnnotation
      An annotation which enables to express that an entity, usually an Activity or a Fragment, wants to report analytics usage.
